instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V42_G3H: What is 3V42_G3H? This is shorthand for PP3V42_G3H which is one of the first power rails that must turn on in older Macbooks that use a magsafe charger in order for them to get a light on the charger. This power rail powers the onewire circuit and the SMC, which are necessary for the machine to communicate with the charger and get it to turn on, as well as begin the bootup sequence. .
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.R7121: What is R7121? Current sense resistor between charger current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H around 4v, quarter fan spin, or battery not charging..
definitions.R7151: What is R7151? Current sense resistor between battery current sense shunt resistor and ISL6259. When these resistors fail the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being sent to or drawn from the battery, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing/sending power to the battery as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
Once booted works fine on battery including sleeping but if I shutdown and dont have charger connected  it wont boot.
Where should I start?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
What is <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage with battery alone (when doesn't turn on)?
Is the battery charging correctly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
With battery only connected
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 12.8v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42v
Battery charges up fine.
No evidence of liquid damage
Tried new keyboard - no change.
Boot loops when charger connected and battery disconnected
Boots fine with charger and battery connected - new bat on order 5 days away!

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
Post exact resistance (ohm scale) between pins 17/18 and 27/28 of <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>.
Check <RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
17/18 3.0 ohms
27/28 20.8 ohms
<RESISTOR>R7121</RESISTOR>/22 and <RESISTOR>R7151</RESISTOR>/52 all look clean, no fractures, not loose

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
Test with known good battery.
Be aware, "chinese new" doesn't mean known good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
I managed to find an old genuine battery. Still doesn't boot from battery only. (well occasionally it will) Ive also tried a new keyboard.
Perhaps Ive just got a fractured board. The only thing I haven't swapped out is the trackpad.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
Just in case, disconnect KB and use <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/16 pads, instead of power button.
Be sure PCH's RTC signals have correct level.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
The <RESISTOR>R5115</RESISTOR>/6 pads reliably initiate boot with charger attached but not with battery only.

<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL>  3.42v when charger attached and same with battery only
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_PCH_DCPRTC</SIGNAL> 1.57v when using charger
<SIGNAL>PPVOUT_S0_PCH_DCPRTC</SIGNAL> 1.3v when using battery only

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
We discussed so many times about PCH's RTC signals.
And you have couple of years on the forum; can't believe you still can't find them...

Test the board alone, only battery connected (no chgarger, or any other cable).

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
Keep your pants on - I don't come here very often at all yet I pay every month because I like to support it [but I am not enjoying it right now]
.
AFAIK we (you and I) have not discussed  about PCH's RTC signals.
Would it not be appropriate for you to have sent me a link to where they are discussed.
Or do we all have to be familiar with the entire content of this forum? I repair perhaps 5 MacBooks a year yet your personal insult may be based on an assumption that I am reading the forum  more frequently.

Also I will add: how are we supposed to search on this forum when the best the search function can do for "PCH RTC" is "The search could not be completed because the search keywords were too short, too long, or too common."

So your brief advice of "Be sure PCH's RTC signals have correct level" is not as helpful as you might think.

Has anyone ever suggested the search function should be modified to return results for certain short acronyms like pch or rtc even .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> only booting with charger connected
threads.message:
You can find a lot of useful information on other threads in this forum; don't read only yours.
Reading the forum and taking notes, helps you to solve faster your problems.

As in all forums, internal search engine doesn't work too good.
Using google search, adding rossmann forum at the end, works better.

"your personal insult may be based on an assumption that I am reading the forum  more frequently"
Wasn't intended as an insult; I apologize if you took it as that.
